Strompris API¶

Fetch data from https://www.hvakosterstrommen.no/strompris-api and visualize it.

Assignment 5

strompris.fetch_day_prices(date: Optional[date] = None, location: str = 'NO1') → DataFrame¶

Fetch one day of data for one location from hvakosterstrommen.no API.

Parameters:

  • date (datetime.date, optional) – The date to fetch prices from, if no argument is given todays date is fetched.

  • location (str, optional) – Location to get price from, chosen from [“NO1”, “NO2”, …, “NO5”].

Returns:

Dataframe containing prices for the desired day.

Return type:

df (pd.DataFrame)

strompris.fetch_prices(end_date: Optional[date] = None, days: int = 7, locations: tuple[str] = ('NO1', 'NO2', 'NO3', 'NO4', 'NO5')) → DataFrame¶

Fetch prices for multiple days and locations into a single DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • end_date (datetime.date, optional) – Last day to fetch price from, if None is given, todays date is chosen.

  • days (int, optional) – Number of days to fetch.

  • locations (tuple[str], optional) – Locations to fetch prices from, if none is given all prices are returned.

Returns:

Dataframe containing prices for all given regions,

for all given days.

Return type:

df (pd.DataFrame)

strompris.plot_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Plot energy prices over time.

x-axis should be time_start y-axis should be price in NOK each location should get its own line

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe containing prices we want to plot, split across the given regions.

Returns:

Plot generated from the given dataframe.

Return type:

chart (alt.Chart)
